question: 2 (a)
sols_html:
A function \(f\) is continuous as a point a if:

  1. \(f(a)\) is defined

  1. \(\displaystyle \lim_{x \to a} f(x)\) exists, i.e. \(\displaystyle \lim_{x \to a^-} f(x) = \lim_{x \to a^+} f(x) = L\) where L is finite.

  1. \(\displaystyle \lim_{x \to a} = f(a)\)

The first and third conditions ensure that the drawing of \(f\) has no holes; the second and third conditions ensure that the drawing of \(f\) has no jumps.
sols_latex:
A function $f$ is continuous as a point \emph{a} if:

\begin{enumerate}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item
  $f(a)$ is defined
\end{enumerate}

\begin{enumerate}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item
  $\displaystyle \lim_{x \to a} f(x)$ exists, i.e.
  $\displaystyle \lim_{x \to a^-} f(x) = \lim_{x \to a^+} f(x) = L$
  where \emph{L} is finite.
\end{enumerate}

\begin{enumerate}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item
  $\displaystyle \lim_{x \to a} = f(a)$
\end{enumerate}

The first and third conditions ensure that the drawing of $f$ has no
holes; the second and third conditions ensure that the drawing of $f$ has
no jumps.
